# Checklist: Hearing or Trial Preparation

<!-- 
  Purpose: Ensure thorough preparation for court hearings and trials.
  Usage: Adapt for interim applications, CMCs, PTRs, and trials.
  Importance: Proper preparation is essential for advocacy success and client service.
-->

---

## Instructions

- Begin preparation well in advance of hearing date
- Use full checklist for trials; adapt for interim hearings/applications
- Review checklist weekly as hearing approaches
- Final review 48 hours before hearing
- File completed checklist in administration section

---

## Hearing Information

**Matter Reference:** ........................  
**Hearing Type:** [ ] Case Management Conference [ ] Application [ ] Pre-Trial Review [ ] Trial [ ] Other: ........................

**Hearing Date:** ........................  
**Time:** ........................  
**Venue:** ........................  
**Judge:** ........................  
**Estimated Duration:** ........................

**Our Attendance:**
- Counsel: ........................
- Solicitor: ........................
- Client: [ ] Required [ ] Optional [ ] Not required

**Hearing Format:** [ ] In person [ ] Remote [ ] Hybrid

---

## PART A: PREPARATION (4-8 WEEKS BEFORE)

## 1. HEARING DATE AND LOGISTICS

### Hearing Fixed

- [ ] Hearing date confirmed: ........................
- [ ] Hearing listed in: [ ] London [ ] District Registry: ........................
- [ ] Court address and contact details noted
- [ ] Listing confirmed in writing

---

### Counsel

- [ ] Counsel instructed: ........................
- [ ] Availability confirmed
- [ ] Brief delivered: Date ........................
- [ ] Fee agreed: £........................
- [ ] Conference arranged: Date ........................

---

### Client

- [ ] Client notified of hearing date
- [ ] Client availability confirmed
- [ ] Client attendance required: [ ] Yes [ ] No
- [ ] Explained role and what to expect
- [ ] Travel arrangements discussed

---

### Witnesses

| Witness | Availability Confirmed | Travel Arranged | Briefed | Ready |
|---------|----------------------|-----------------|---------|-------|
|         |                      |                 |         |       |
|         |                      |                 |         |       |

- [ ] Witness summons issued if needed
- [ ] Witness expenses arranged

---

### Expert Witnesses

- [ ] Expert availability confirmed: ........................
- [ ] Expert briefed on hearing requirements
- [ ] Travel and accommodation arranged
- [ ] Fee for attendance agreed: £........................

---

## 2. COURT ORDERS AND DIRECTIONS

### Compliance with Directions

**Review all directions orders:**

- [ ] Order dated: ........................ - Compliance: [ ] Full [ ] Partial [ ] Issue

**Check compliance with each direction:**

| Direction | Deadline | Complied | If Not, Action |
|-----------|----------|----------|----------------|
|           |          |          |                |
|           |          |          |                |

- [ ] All directions complied with
- [ ] Any non-compliance explained and permission sought if needed
- [ ] Relief from sanctions application filed if required

---

### Court Bundle Directions

- [ ] Bundle directions in order dated: ........................
- [ ] Responsibility for bundle: [ ] Us [ ] Opponent [ ] Agreed
- [ ] Bundle format: [ ] Paper [ ] Electronic [ ] Both
- [ ] Number of copies required: ........................
- [ ] Filing deadline: ........................
- [ ] Service on opponent deadline: ........................

---

## 3. EVIDENCE

### Witness Statements

- [ ] All witness statements filed/served
- [ ] Client's statement: Date ........................
- [ ] Other witnesses: [List and dates]
- [ ] Opponent's statements received and reviewed
- [ ] All exhibits properly marked and paginated

---

### Expert Reports

- [ ] Our expert report(s) filed: Date ........................
- [ ] Opponent's expert report(s) received: Date ........................
- [ ] Experts' discussion completed (if ordered)
- [ ] Joint statement prepared (if ordered)
- [ ] Permission for experts to attend hearing (if required)

---

### Documents

- [ ] All key documents identified
- [ ] Disclosed documents indexed
- [ ] Original documents located and available if needed
- [ ] Copies prepared for bundle

---

## 4. SKELETON ARGUMENTS

### Our Skeleton Argument

**Deadline:** ........................

- [ ] Skeleton argument drafted
- [ ] Covers all issues in dispute
- [ ] Identifies legal authorities
- [ ] References key evidence and documents
- [ ] Concise and well-structured
- [ ] Reviewed by counsel/supervisor
- [ ] Client approved (if appropriate)
- [ ] Filed: Date ........................
- [ ] Served on opponent: Date ........................
- [ ] Copies prepared for court

**Length:** ........................ pages [ ] Within court guidelines

---

### Opponent's Skeleton Argument

- [ ] Received: Date ........................
- [ ] Reviewed and analyzed
- [ ] New points identified and researched
- [ ] Response prepared (if necessary)

---

## 5. LEGAL AUTHORITIES

### Authorities Bundle

- [ ] All cases cited in skeleton identified
- [ ] Photocopies of authorities prepared
- [ ] Authorities bundle prepared
- [ ] Relevant passages highlighted
- [ ] Bundle served on opponent: Date ........................
- [ ] Copies for court prepared

**Cases included:**
1. [........................]
2. [........................]
3. [........................]

**Legislation included:**
- [ ] Wills Act 1837 (relevant sections)
- [ ] Inheritance Act 1975 (relevant sections)
- [ ] [Other statutes]

---

### Legal Research

- [ ] All legal issues researched
- [ ] Recent case law checked
- [ ] Practice directions reviewed
- [ ] Chancery Guide consulted
- [ ] Research memo prepared
- [ ] Counsel briefed on authorities

---

## 6. CHRONOLOGY

### Chronology Prepared

- [ ] Comprehensive chronology drafted
- [ ] Key dates identified
- [ ] Cross-referenced to documents
- [ ] Agreed with opponent where possible
- [ ] Separate chronologies if disagreement
- [ ] Included in bundle

**Format:** [ ] Table [ ] Narrative [ ] Both

---

## 7. OTHER SCHEDULES AND DOCUMENTS

### Dramatis Personae

- [ ] List of persons mentioned prepared
- [ ] Relationships explained
- [ ] Included in bundle

---

### Glossary/Index of Terms

- [ ] Technical terms explained (if applicable)
- [ ] Abbreviations listed

---

### Schedules

- [ ] Schedule of assets (if relevant)
- [ ] Schedule of loss/claim (if quantification issue)
- [ ] Family tree/diagram
- [ ] [Other schedules as needed]

---

## PART B: BUNDLE PREPARATION (2-4 WEEKS BEFORE)

## 8. TRIAL/HEARING BUNDLE

### Bundle Preparation Responsibility

**Responsible party:** [ ] Us [ ] Opponent [ ] Agreed division

**If our responsibility:**

- [ ] Bundle structure agreed with opponent
- [ ] Document numbering agreed
- [ ] Pagination method agreed

---

### Bundle Contents

#### Core Documents Section

- [ ] Claim form and particulars of claim
- [ ] Defence (and counterclaim if any)
- [ ] Reply
- [ ] All case management orders
- [ ] PTR order (if applicable)
- [ ] Consent orders/agreements

#### Statements and Reports

- [ ] All witness statements in chronological order
- [ ] All expert reports
- [ ] Joint statements
- [ ] Hearsay notices (if applicable)

#### Documents

- [ ] Key documents in chronological order
- [ ] Will(s)
- [ ] Grant of probate
- [ ] Medical records (if relevant)
- [ ] Correspondence
- [ ] Financial documents
- [ ] [Other disclosed documents]

---

### Bundle Compilation

- [ ] Documents assembled
- [ ] Paginated consecutively (bottom right corner)
- [ ] Index prepared with page references
- [ ] Sections divided with tabs
- [ ] Multiple volumes if necessary (label clearly)
- [ ] Spine labels prepared

**Total pages:** ........................

**Number of volumes:** ........................

---

### Bundle Quality Check

- [ ] All pages legible
- [ ] Correct order
- [ ] No missing documents
- [ ] Index accurate
- [ ] Page numbers correct
- [ ] Professional presentation

---

### Bundle Agreement

- [ ] Draft index sent to opponent for agreement
- [ ] Opponent's comments received
- [ ] Disagreements resolved or noted
- [ ] Final index agreed or separate indices prepared

---

### Filing and Service

**Paper Bundles:**

- [ ] Number of copies prepared: ........................
  - Court: ........................
  - Judge: ........................  
  - Us: ........................
  - Opponent: ........................
  - Witnesses: ........................

- [ ] Filed with court: Date ........................
- [ ] Served on opponent: Date ........................
- [ ] Certificate of service prepared

**Electronic Bundles:**

- [ ] PDF prepared (hyperlinked if possible)
- [ ] File size acceptable for court system
- [ ] Uploaded to court platform: Date ........................
- [ ] Sent to opponent: Date ........................

**Deadline compliance:** [ ] On time [ ] Late - explanation provided

---

## PART C: FINAL PREPARATION (1-2 WEEKS BEFORE)

## 9. CONFERENCE WITH COUNSEL

### Conference Arranged

**Date:** ........................  
**Time:** ........................  
**Location:** [ ] Chambers [ ] Our office [ ] Video conference

**Attendees:**
- [ ] Counsel
- [ ] Solicitor: ........................
- [ ] Client
- [ ] [Others if appropriate]

---

### Preparation for Conference

- [ ] Brief updated if necessary
- [ ] Key issues identified for discussion
- [ ] Questions for counsel prepared
- [ ] Settlement authority from client obtained
- [ ] All recent developments notified to counsel

---

### Conference Outcomes

- [ ] Case strategy confirmed
- [ ] Evidence reviewed
- [ ] Skeleton argument discussed
- [ ] Settlement prospects assessed
- [ ] Client advised
- [ ] Any additional preparation identified
- [ ] Attendance note prepared and filed

---

## 10. WITNESS PREPARATION

### Client Preparation

- [ ] Conference held to prepare client
- [ ] Explained court procedure
- [ ] Reviewed witness statement with client
- [ ] Explained cross-examination process
- [ ] Addressed client concerns
- [ ] Court etiquette discussed
- [ ] What to wear advised
- [ ] Mock cross-examination (if appropriate)

**Meeting date:** ........................

---

### Other Witness Preparation

For each witness:

**Witness 1:** ........................

- [ ] Meeting arranged: Date ........................
- [ ] Witness statement reviewed
- [ ] Explained hearing process
- [ ] Cross-examination discussed
- [ ] Questions answered
- [ ] Logistical arrangements confirmed

[Repeat for each witness]

---

### Expert Preparation

- [ ] Expert briefed on court procedure
- [ ] Expert's report reviewed with expert
- [ ] Opponent's expert report discussed
- [ ] Joint statement discussed
- [ ] Questions prepared for expert
- [ ] Expert reminded of duty to court

---

## 11. ADVOCACY PREPARATION

### Case Theory and Theme

- [ ] Case theory articulated clearly
- [ ] Key themes identified
- [ ] Opening statement prepared
- [ ] Closing argument outlined

---

### Cross-Examination

- [ ] Cross-examination plan for each opponent witness
- [ ] Key points to establish identified
- [ ] Damaging admissions to seek noted
- [ ] Documents for cross-examination marked
- [ ] Questions prepared

---

### Examination in Chief (If Applicable)

- [ ] Questions prepared for our witnesses
- [ ] Structure planned
- [ ] Documents to take witnesses to identified

---

### Submissions

- [ ] Legal submissions prepared
- [ ] Authorities organized
- [ ] Key passages marked
- [ ] Response to anticipated opponent arguments prepared

---

## 12. SETTLEMENT

### Settlement Position

- [ ] Settlement prospects re-assessed
- [ ] Client's settlement authority confirmed
  - Minimum acceptable: ........................
  - Maximum offer: ........................
  - Costs position on settlement

- [ ] Part 36 offer made/received status:
  - [ ] We made offer: Date ........................ Terms: ........................
  - [ ] They made offer: Date ........................ Terms: ........................
  - [ ] Implications for costs considered

---

### Pre-Hearing Negotiations

- [ ] Contact opponent re settlement
- [ ] Without prejudice discussions held
- [ ] Offers exchanged
- [ ] Mediation proposed/scheduled
- [ ] Settlement terms drafted (if agreement reached)
- [ ] Consent order prepared (if settling)

**If settled:**
- [ ] Consent order filed
- [ ] Hearing vacated
- [ ] Client and court notified

---

## PART D: FINAL CHECKS (1 WEEK BEFORE)

## 13. LOGISTICS

### Travel and Accommodation

- [ ] Travel to court planned
- [ ] Parking/public transport checked
- [ ] Accommodation booked if required
- [ ] Arrival time planned (allowing buffer)

---

### Court and Facilities

- [ ] Court location and courtroom identified
- [ ] Building access/security arrangements noted
- [ ] Facilities for client/witnesses identified
- [ ] Video link tested (if remote hearing)
- [ ] Technical support contact details obtained

---

### Materials to Bring

- [ ] Bundles (x........................)
- [ ] Skeleton arguments
- [ ] Authorities bundle
- [ ] Notebook/pad
- [ ] Pens/highlighters
- [ ] Client file
- [ ] Laptop/tablet (if permitted)
- [ ] Phone charger
- [ ] Water
- [ ] Business cards

---

## 14. FINAL REVIEW

### 48-Hour Review

- [ ] All documents reviewed
- [ ] Skeleton argument re-read
- [ ] Authorities checked
- [ ] Witness statements reviewed
- [ ] Key points noted
- [ ] Anticipated issues prepared for

---

### Team Briefing

- [ ] Counsel briefed on any last-minute developments
- [ ] Junior team members briefed on roles
- [ ] Contact details exchanged
- [ ] Back-up arrangements confirmed

---

### Client Communication

- [ ] Final call with client before hearing
- [ ] Logistics confirmed
- [ ] Settlement position confirmed
- [ ] Questions addressed
- [ ] Client reassured and prepared

---

## 15. CASE MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE SPECIFIC

### If CMC

- [ ] Directions questionnaire filed
- [ ] Costs budget filed (Precedent H)
- [ ] Budget discussion report filed
- [ ] List of issues prepared
- [ ] Proposed directions prepared
- [ ] Opponent's proposed directions reviewed

---

## 16. APPLICATION HEARING SPECIFIC

### If Interim Application

- [ ] Application notice filed
- [ ] Evidence in support filed
- [ ] Respondent's evidence reviewed
- [ ] Draft order prepared
- [ ] Authorities for legal test identified
- [ ] Costs of application considered

---

## 17. TRIAL SPECIFIC ADDITIONAL ITEMS

### If Trial

- [ ] Opening note prepared
- [ ] Closing submissions skeleton prepared
- [ ] Questions for judge anticipated
- [ ] Judgment research (if novel point)
- [ ] Remedies and relief clarified
- [ ] Quantum evidence ready (if applicable)
- [ ] Draft order prepared
- [ ] Costs schedule prepared

---

## 18. CONTINGENCY PLANNING

### Potential Issues

- [ ] Adjournment application - grounds prepared if needed
- [ ] Additional evidence - procedure for admitting late evidence understood
- [ ] Amendment to pleadings - procedure understood
- [ ] Technical difficulties - backup plan for remote hearings
- [ ] Witness non-attendance - witness summons available

---

## 19. AFTER THE HEARING

### Post-Hearing Actions

- [ ] Note of judgment/order obtained
- [ ] Client debriefed
- [ ] Attendance note prepared
- [ ] Order drawn up (if required)
- [ ] Order served (if required)
- [ ] Costs assessed/negotiated
- [ ] Next steps identified
- [ ] File updated
- [ ] Time recorded

---

## 20. QUALITY AND RISK

### Quality Check

- [ ] All preparation completed
- [ ] No outstanding items
- [ ] Team confident and ready
- [ ] Client satisfied with preparation

---

### Risk Assessment

**Identified risks:**
1. [........................]
2. [........................]

**Mitigation:**
- [ ] All risks addressed or managed
- [ ] Supervisor informed of any concerns

---

## SIGN-OFF

### Preparation Complete

**Completed by:** ........................  
**Date:** ........................

**Ready for hearing:** [ ] Yes [ ] Outstanding items: [........................]

### Supervisor Review

**Reviewed by:** ........................  
**Date:** ........................

**Approved:** [ ] Yes [ ] Comments: [........................]

---

## DAY OF HEARING CHECKLIST

### Morning of Hearing

- [ ] Review key points
- [ ] Check all materials packed
- [ ] Leave in good time
- [ ] Arrive early (30+ minutes before)
- [ ] Check in with court staff
- [ ] Find courtroom
- [ ] Meet client and witnesses
- [ ] Brief conference with counsel
- [ ] Telephone client's supporters if appropriate

---

### In Court

- [ ] Professional demeanor
- [ ] Take comprehensive notes
- [ ] Assist counsel as needed
- [ ] Monitor client's wellbeing
- [ ] Communicate key points to client during breaks

---

### After Hearing

- [ ] Debrief with counsel
- [ ] Explain outcome to client
- [ ] Obtain order
- [ ] Plan next steps
- [ ] Celebrate if successful!

---

## Notes

_Record any special considerations or issues for this hearing:_

[........................]

**Remember:** Preparation is everything. The better prepared you are, the better the outcome for your client.
